Cape_Coral.Florida SouthWestern State College: Florida SouthWestern State College (also referred to as FSW or Florida SouthWestern) is a state college in Southwest Florida. It was founded in 1962 and named after Thomas Edison as Edison Junior College, renamed Edison Community College in 1972, renamed Edison College in 2004, renamed Edison State College in 2008, and finally renamed Florida SouthWestern State College in 2014. The college has its main campus in Fort Myers in Lee County, satellite campuses in Charlotte and Collier counties, and outreach programs in Hendry and Glades counties.
